section.title: Part B: Social Check
section.subtitle: AUTHENTICITY CHECK - Ensuring your profile is genuine
section.description: Answer these questions as honestly as possible. There are no right or wrong answers.
section.note: These questions help ensure authentic responses throughout the assessment.

domains.name: Social Desirability
domains.description: Tendency to present oneself in an overly positive light

questions.text: I have never told a lie.
I have never felt jealous of someone else's success.
I always follow all rules, even when no one is watching.
I have never said something I later regretted.
I have never felt annoyed with my family or close friends.
I always complete every task I start, no matter what.
I have never procrastinated on important work.
I have never felt lazy or unmotivated.
I always treat everyone with perfect fairness.
I have never judged someone based on their appearance.
I sometimes make excuses to get out of things I don't want to do.
I have occasionally taken credit for something I didn't fully do.
I sometimes pretend to understand things when I don't.
I have broken small rules when I thought no one would notice.
I sometimes exaggerate my achievements slightly.
I have occasionally been late because I underestimated how long something would take.
I sometimes say I'm fine when I'm actually upset.
I have occasionally gossiped about someone.
I sometimes get distracted when I should be paying attention.
I have felt envious of others at times.

authentic.label: Authentic Responder
authentic.description: Your responses appear genuine and honest.

moderate.label: Moderate Image Management
moderate.description: Some tendency to present positively, but generally reliable.

high.label: High Image Management
high.description: Consider retaking the assessment with more candid responses.

note: This scale detects 'too good to be true' responses. High scores suggest the person may be presenting an idealized self-image rather than their authentic self.
